abstract: Airline industry is regaining control of its fortunes and making money on rising fares, more fees and fewer, but more crowded, flights; domestic airlines will have their second consecutive profitable year in 2011, after losing $55 billion since 2001; American Airlines is exception in reinvigorated industry and is expected to report another quarterly loss.
snippet: The rising ticket prices and mushrooming fees that annoy air travelers have helped airlines make money during the economic downturn.
lead_paragraph: The rising ticket prices and mushrooming fees that annoy air travelers have helped airlines make money during the economic downturn.

headline.main: Airlines Battle Back to Profit, a Fare and a Fee at a Time
headline.seo: Airlines Battle Back to Profit, a Fare and a Fee at a Time
